children.subject: That makes sense, but I need to add a class for that very reason so just wondering if adding is possible?

I suggest talking to an L&S academic advisor about late adding. If you've already used up your late change/add, they might approve you for a second one if you have exceptional circumstances. They also know more about the process of late adding and what you need to do to late add.

I'd still recommend talking to a financial aid advisor separately, if you have any scholarships, and go over how late drop might affect you. It will affect your SAP last I check.

Thank you! If I have not used my late add, do I simply need to add the class through CalCentral or do I need to petition it? I’ve read through a bunch of things on the college website, but am still kind confused. Thank you for the help!!

Also, I’m a bit confused about the wording of the instructors answer. To clarify, I would be able to late drop without penalty using CalCentral, but late adding a class will essentially be using my “one late change for here at Berkeley”? Any clarifications would be much appreciated!!

There is no longer a way to add the class via CalCentral since it is past the add/drop deadline. The only way to be enrolled now is to use the late change process to ask for the late add. 

To clarify - yes, you can use the late DROP if needed without that counting towards the 'one time only' rule. But, if you ask to SWAP or ADD a class, it does count towards the 'one time only' rule.

It makes sense if you think about it - the college wants to support students who have extenuating circumstances during the pandemic/remote learning & need to drop. But, if we didn't have the 'one time only' rule for late adds/swaps, people could use the late change process to bypass the add/drop deadline for classes that had waitlists.

Thank you for your rapid response, I appreciate it so, so much! So if I go through the process of adding a class using this form, would you recommend that I begin attending the class/completing the assignments while I am in this process (as it might take awhile for me to get a signature from my advisor)?

Also, would you happen to know who I could speak to if I fall below the 13 unit requirement as an Academic Student Employee? Thank you!!!!!

Now you're beyond my area of expertise - I recommend that you make an appointment with an L&S Advisor to ask these questions since they specialize in helping students and know the rules about units per semester and about the petition process/timing. My focus is class-based for enrollments. You should be able to find info for L&S Advising on the top of the page I linked to before.
Thank you for your help! I will reach out to the appropriate people!!
My understanding is that if you late drop, the l&s 13 unit minimum would be waived. You still need to check with finantial aid separately though.

history.content:
https://lsadvising.berkeley.edu/policies/late-change-class-schedule

According to the notice at the top of that page, late adds & changes are subject to the regular policy.

I'm not sure if this is the right place to ask this, but I was wondering if it is still possible to drop a class and add another one right now? What I understand is that policies have changed so the "Late Change of Class Schedule" one-time policy does not count for the Spring 2021 semester, so I can drop classes until the April 30, 2021 at 11:59pm PT deadline. However, what is the policy for adding courses if I still need to fulfill my 13 unit cap? Any help/clarifications would be appreciated! (For context I am in the College of L&S)
history.subject: Add/Drop Classes Spring 2021 Semester
